key_points: Americans express horror, disgust, and sadness over the Capitol riot on January 6.
Viewers compare the events to 9/11 and describe it as a turning point for the nation.
The majority hold President Trump accountable and demand his removal from office.
There is also significant blame placed on lawmakers who supported Trump, with calls for their removal.
Many respondents highlight the perceived inaction of police compared to their treatment of Black Lives Matter protesters.
The racial double standards and hypocrisy in the treatment of protesters are strongly criticized.
Some see the events as an embodiment of fascism and a significant threat to democracy.
A recurring theme is the fragility of America's democracy and the critical state of the nation.
There are emotional testimonies about fearing for the future of the country.
Viewers demand accountability for both Trump and complicit lawmakers, as well as action to restore democracy.
